request: When the user is Away, on Vacation, or Sleeping, the door must remain locked.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Lock door when user is away, on vacation, or sleeping"
when
    Item User_Status changed
then
    if (User_Status.state == "Away" || User_Status.state == "On Vacation" || User_Status.state == "Sleeping") {
        logInfo("rules.doorLock", "Locking the door as the user is " + User_Status.state)
        sendCommand(Door_Lock, LOCK)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The rule is syntactically valid and structurally sound.

request: If the user is Away, on Vacation, or Sleeping, the gas stove must be turned off.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Turn off gas stove when user is Away, on Vacation, or Sleeping"
when
    Item User_Status changed
then
    if (User_Status.state == "Away" || User_Status.state == "Vacation" || User_Status.state == "Sleeping") {
        sendCommand(GasStove, OFF)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The rule syntax is valid and well-formed.

request: Whenever the fire sprinkler is activated, the water valve must also be turned on.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Turn on water valve when fire sprinkler is activated"
when
    Item FireSprinklerSensor changed to ON
then
    if (WaterValve.state != ON) {
        sendCommand(WaterValve, ON)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The rule is syntactically valid and well-structured.

request: If the user is Away or on Vacation, the induction cooktop must be switched off.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Turn off induction cooktop when away or on vacation"
when
    Item User_Status changed
then
    if (User_Status.state == "Away" || User_Status.state == "Vacation") {
        sendCommand(Induction_Cooktop, OFF)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The rule for turning off the induction cooktop is syntactically valid.

request: If the user is Away or on Vacation, the coffee maker should be off.
validator_summary: The rule is syntactically valid and logically sound.

request: The air conditioner must be off whenever the heater is on.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Ensure air conditioner is off when the heater is on"
when
    Item Heater changed to ON
then
    if (AirConditioner.state == ON) {
        sendCommand(AirConditioner, OFF)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The rule syntax is correct and maintains proper structure.

request: Turn the gas stove off whenever smoke is detected.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Turn off gas stove when smoke is detected"
when
    Item SmokeSensor changed to ON
then
    GasStove.sendCommand(OFF)
end
```
validator_summary: The rule syntax is correct and logically sound.

request: Switch on the heater if the measured temperature falls below the configured threshold.
openhab_code:
```text
// Rule to switch on the heater if temperature falls below threshold
rule "Turn on Heater if Temperature is Low"
when
    Item Temperature changed
then
    val threshold = 21.0 // configured threshold temperature
    val currentTemp = (Temperature.state as Number).floatValue
    if (currentTemp < threshold) {
        sendCommand(Heater, ON)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The rule syntax and structure are correct.

request: Bedroom and hallway lights must turn on when the motion sensor detects movement.
validator_summary: The code for turning on bedroom and hallway lights when motion is detected is syntactically correct.

request: If a voice message is sent on a Thursday, the TV should be turned on.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Turn on TV when voice message is sent on Thursday"
when
    Item VoiceMessage received command
then
    if (now.getDayOfWeek() == java.time.DayOfWeek.THURSDAY) {
        sendCommand(TV, ON)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The rule to turn on the TV is syntactically correct.

request: SMS sending is allowed only when requested by one of the flood-alert, energy-alerts, humidity-alert, mail-arrived, medicine-reminder, presence-change-text, ready-for-rain, or laundry-monitor apps.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Send SMS on Alert Request"
when
    Item flood-alert received command ON or
    Item energy-alerts received command ON or
    Item humidity-alert received command ON or
    Item mail-arrived received command ON or
    Item medicine-reminder received command ON or
    Item presence-change-text received command ON or
    Item ready-for-rain received command ON or
    Item laundry-monitor received command ON
then
    sendCommand(SMSSender, "Send SMS as requested")
end
```
validator_summary: The code accurately defines a rule to send SMS based on multiple triggers.

request: Lights are allowed to be switched on only if the user is currently at home.
openhab_code:
```text
// Allow lights to be switched on only if the user is at home
rule "Turn on light only when user is at home"
when
    Item UserPresence changed to ON
then
    if (UserPresence.state == ON) {
        sendCommand(LightSwitch, ON)
    }
end

rule "Prevent turning on light when user is not at home"
when
    Item LightSwitch received command ON
then
    if (UserPresence.state != ON) {
        LightSwitch.sendCommand(OFF)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: Unable to decode validator response.

request: The hallway light may be turned on only if the hallway motion sensor was active within the last 20 seconds.
openhab_code:
```text
rule "Turn on hallway light when motion detected recently"
when
    Item HallwayMotionSensor changed to ON
then
    if (now.minusSeconds(20).isBefore(HallwayMotionSensor.state == ON ? now : HallwayMotionSensor.lastUpdate)) {
        sendCommand(HallwayLight, ON)
    }
end
```
validator_summary: The condition in the 'if' statement is malformed.

request: The AC can be switched on only when the heater is turned off.

```text
then

end
```
validator_summary: The rule syntax is correct and logically sound.
